img.alt: Vertical pivoted bar struck by horizontal projectile

problem.p: A uniform bar of mass \(m\) and length \(l\) is suspended on a frictionless hinge. A horizontally launched blob of clay of mass \(m\) strikes the bottom end of the bar and sticks to it. After that, the bar swings upward. What is the minimum initial speed \(v\) of the blob of clay that would enable the rod to swing a full circle?
Which concepts/laws would be most helpful in solving this problem? Select the best answer from the options below.
